DataElement.preferredName: Material Storage Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Subcategory Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An administrative activity defined at a global library level that is an action of safekeeping harvested material in a repository or depository. EXAMPLE(S): refrigeration, cryopreservation, dehydration NOTE(S): There is a difference between the act of changing the state of material, which is represented here, and the act of maintaining state of the material by storing it. A coded value specifying a subdivision within a larger category of activities. EXAMPLE(S): (1) chemotherapy, radiotherapy, hormonal therapy, alternative therapy (2) In the case where category code = "anti-cancer treatment", subcategory code may = "radiotherapy", and name code may = "external beam radiotherapy". (3) If category code = "Intervention", subcategory code may = "Drug" (including placebo), "Device" (including sham), "Biological/Vaccine", "Procedure/Surgery", "Radiation", "Behavioral" (e.g., Psychotherapy, Lifestyle Counseling), "Genetic" (including gene transfer, stem cell and recombinant DNA), Dietary Supplement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Material Storage Administration Reuse Template Study Activity Subcategory Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._A subdivision that has common differentiating characteristics within a larger category.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG 3.2 Release Note
ReferenceDocuments.description: Due to technical difficulties we are unable to correct a known error in the BRIDG model as loaded to caDSR. The association between DefinedMaterialStorage and Specimen is deprecated in BRIDG 3.2 and should not have been loaded to caDSR.

DataElement.changeDescription: Added BRIDG 3.2 Release Note as Association Reference Document. mc 5/15/13  Moved UML alt def to CDE preferred def and released per model owner approval. mc 6/2013
